Articles.Content:
Here, first thing I've ever modelled for use in a game as an addon. :V

They're warp nacelles! With appropriate thrust. Although, it's quite hard to use them. They tend to rip apart the spacecraft and/or cause it to fall apart. However, they're fast!

Have a picture.

Have a video.

Have a download link. >_>

http://www.speedyshare.com/files/29416858/Nacelle.rar

Awesome texture! [/irony]

How about realism? Is these realistic?

Bad fuckin' ass.

Engage, make it so, etc.

Awesome texture! [/irony]

How about realism? Is these realistic?

I'm a terrible artist/texture-guy. I'm trying to get better though. :c

Also, you're asking whether a warp nacelle is realistic? ;P

That ship looks like the Phoenix, first Earth-made manned space craft to achieve warp drive.

As seen in Star Trek: First Contact

That ship looks like the Phoenix, first Earth-made manned space craft to achieve warp drive.

As seen in Star Trek: First Contact

And my first planned mod for Kerbal (The Phoenix) =(

At least im not the only one thinking about it =D
Nothing but explosions here, mind you it's pretty funny!
Warp nacelles are not boosters.
I realise that, but unfortunately liquid engines cannot have internal fuel as far as I know, and so they had to be boosters to prevent having to have two fuel tanks sticking out the top.

I realise that, but unfortunately liquid engines cannot have internal fuel as far as I know, and so they had to be boosters to prevent having to have two fuel tanks sticking out the top.

Why not make 3 different components so your warp nacelles can be liquid? One is the back, the actual thrusting portion of the nacelle, and then you can make a middle and a cap section for nacelle fuel?

Here, first thing I've ever modelled for use in a game as an addon. :V

They're warp nacelles! With appropriate thrust. Although, it's quite hard to use them. They tend to rip apart the spacecraft and/or cause it to fall apart. However, they're fast!

Have a picture.

-snips-

I recommend turning down the luminosity a little bit. Or specularity, I forget what the value is called in the script. But anyway, reminds me of the SRB's on the Space Shuttle.
Yeah, these are way too powerful to actually use, I suggest turning them down a little bit.
has anyone successfully used these?
I can get them into space then they leave my ship look really good though needs its own fixtures though to attach them as nothing is strong enough due to there superbly obscene acceleration
That is true. I was attempting to design a better looking one, but my skills are still limited and blender UV mapping is horrible. x_x
Yeah, that's what we need. Actually beefy pylons. Radial decouplers are not Best Decouplers.
maybe its just me but I installed the Nacelle's files and all it seams to be doing is loading...... :-X
That's weird - keep waiting? May be just you, nobody else seems affected.
They just explode on ignition: no matter what is ignited. Even if they arent started and in a diffrent stage, they explode.
I turned the thrust down a bit and they work fine when hard attached to a medium solid booster

Good job, the First contact movie was first thing I rembered when I saw the irst pic.

But can someone please reupload it ? Link is not working for me.
Nacelles are awesome!

Hi ! I like your Nacelles

And I do not want to hijack your thread on purpose but I made some warp-nacelles myself

Included in the first release of some Trek-related modules:

I guess the parts need some tweaking physics-wise. Please let me know if you got any ideas in improving them.

See attachments.

/evilmaddy

Hi ! I like your Nacelles

And I do not want to hijack your thread on purpose but I made some warp-nacelles myself

Included in the first release of some Trek-related modules:

I guess the parts need some tweaking physics-wise. Please let me know if you got any ideas in improving them.

See attachments.

/evilmaddy

Kudos to you, those look fantastic! I was trying something like this myself, but had major problems attempting to UV map it so gave up.

As a suggestion, I think it may look better if the attachment pylons were slightly lower down and if the nacelles were a bit thinner, but otherwise, awesome.
Forget about the nacelles, hell, the fuel tanks and impulse engines on that puppy are enough to put you into deep space!
